About

The nerdy dude in the group, an artist in his solitude. Yeah you guessed it right! The art you just saw above is one of my creations. A young and ambitious lad from the city of Bhubaneswar, I choose to remain quiet and calm most of the time. Sometimes you can see a lazy sloth sleeping all the day in his uncomfortable bed, procrastinating. Oh, that’s me! I rejoice making my mental repository more diverse and informative.

I currently am a Software Developer in the Private Banking and Assets Management team at Societe Generale. A fresh graduate from the department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering in Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur. I am a believer in power of open source to change the world and am an active developer for Apertium, coala and gitmate organisations. In the past, I have been a mentor for coala organisation in Google Code-in, 2017 edition and student for Apertium organisation in Google Summer of Code, 2018 edition.

Got some free time? Scroll down to read more!!! Believe me, I won’t bore you for a moment.

To see what I am upto, follow my github handler Techievena!!!!

Latest Blog Post

03 Nov 2018 . Alexa . Smart Apertium Comments

MOTIVATION KIA ORA, MATE - A news article that popped up on my notifications screen yesterday demonstrated the power of language in our society. It was the disastrous failure of the conglomerate Coca Cola ad campaign while attempting to combine reo Maori and English. This has backfired quite badly as the company has inadvertently written “Hello, Death” on a vending machine in New Zealand. It is quite inappropriate to regard language just as a method for communication. Huge experiences, history, and views of the world human being have been soaked deeply into a language since the...
